metadata.Title: CVE-2019-6444 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in NTPsec before 1.1.3. process_control() in ntp_control.c has a stack-based buffer over-read because attacker-controlled data is dereferenced by ntohl() in ntpd.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-6444` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ntpsec - 1.1.0+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.2
ntpsec-ntpdate - 1.1.0+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.2
ntpsec-ntpviz - 1.1.0+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.2
python3-ntp - 1.1.0+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ntpsec package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.1.0+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.2').
